item.title: Pam add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Life is a succession of lessons which must be lived to be understood." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Pam add a quote by Bessie Anderson Stanley
Pam add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Pam add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "In my walks, every man I meet is my superior in some way, and in that I learn from him." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Pam add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "A friend may be nature's most magnificent creation." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Pam add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "If a man does not keep pace with his companions, perhaps it is because he hears a different drummer. Let him step to the music he hears, however measured or far away." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Pam add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "If you are going through hell, keep going." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Pam add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak; courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Pam add a quote by Sir Winston Churchill
item.description: "To each there comes in their lifetime a special moment when they are figuratively tapped on the shoulder and offered the chance to do a very special thing, unique to them and fitted to their talents. What a tragedy if that moment finds them unprepared or unqualified for that which could have been their finest hour." -- Sir Winston Churchill

item.title: Pam add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "A man is not idle because he is absorbed in thought. There is visible labor and there is invisible labor." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Pam add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "When one door of happiness closes, another opens; but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one which has been opened for us." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Pam add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "Life is either a daring adventure or nothing at all." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Pam add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "What we once enjoyed and deeply loved we can never lose, For all that we love deeply becomes a part of us." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Pam add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "The most pathetic person in the world is some one who has sight but no vision." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Pam add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "Although the world is full of suffering, it is full also of the overcoming of it." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Pam add a quote by E.E. Cummings
item.description: "It takes courage to grow up and become who you really are." -- E.E. Cummings
